description: Seasons of Bali: sunlit mornings, monsoon nights â€” a soundtrack for island transitions.

items.name: Gitgit Waterfall
items.description: This gorgeous waterfall in Bedugul is Gitgit. Cascading down from a height of 35 meters, it is a spectacular fall, surrounded by lush green forests. Located between Bedugul and Singaraja, this Gitgit waterfall can be reached by a small hike.

items.name: Sekumpul Waterfall
items.description: Sekumpul Waterfall is every nature lovers delight. Known as one of the best waterfalls in Bali, Sekumpul is a cluster of 6 to 7 narrow cascades, plunging down from an average height of 80 metres. Surrounded by lush green bamboo woods, this waterfall is reached by a moderately challenging trek, on the route to Lovina Beach.
items.location_hint: Sekumpul, Sawan, Lemukih, Sawan, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali

items.name: Blahmantung Waterfalls
items.description: One of the best waterfalls in Bali Indonesia, also known as Pupuan waterfall is stunningly beautiful. The water cascades down from a height of 100 m. Blahmantung is a group of three waterfalls. The first and second cascade is close to each other, located near a shrine. The third waterfall is secluded, amid a forest, opposite to an irrigation dam. But all the three are breathtakingly gorgeous and offers a relaxing respite from clutters and noise of cities.

items.name: Goa Rang Reng Waterfall
items.description: Next on the list is Goa Rang Reng Waterfall, a breath-taking cascade, located around the regency of Gianyar. Cascading down through a series of rocky steps in multiple layers, this is one of the best Bali waterfalls, ideal for day trips and picnics. The natives consider the water as scared and the place is often used for purification rituals and ceremonies.
